<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### createWideIV() {#a5586ec5eac8a93b87b095f949ea8daf3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>PHINode &#42; WidenIV::createWideIV (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevexpander">SCEVExpander</a> &amp; Rewriter)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process">Process</a> a single induction variable.

First use the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevexpander">SCEVExpander</a> to create a wide induction variable that evaluates to the same recurrence as the original narrow IV. Then use a worklist to forward traverse the narrow IV&#39;s def-use chain. After widenIVUse has processed all interesting IV users, the narrow IV will be isolated for removal by DeleteDeadPHIs.

It would be simpler to delete uses as they are processed, but we must avoid invalidating <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expressions.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp/#l01135">1135</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp">SimplifyIndVar.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### cloneIVUser() {#a7ee5e663199f460b53a80855073e21bd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Instruction &#42; WidenIV::cloneIVUser (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-simplifyindvar-cpp-/wideniv/narrowivdefuse">NarrowIVDefUse</a> DU, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddrecexpr">SCEVAddRecExpr</a> &#42; WideAR)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Instantiate a wide operation to replace a narrow operation.

This only needs to handle operations that can evaluation to SCEVAddRec. It can safely return 0 for any operation we decide not to clone.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp/#l01144">1144</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp">SimplifyIndVar.cpp</a>.

### getExtendedOperandRecurrence() {#a5acadc27f8741ff017a264df16bb8885}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>WidenIV::WidenedRecTy WidenIV::getExtendedOperandRecurrence (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-simplifyindvar-cpp-/wideniv/narrowivdefuse">NarrowIVDefUse</a> DU)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
No-wrap operations can transfer sign extension of their result to their operands.

Generate the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> value for the widened operation without actually modifying the IR yet. If the expression after extending the operands is an AddRec for this loop, return the AddRec and the kind of extension used.

### getWideRecurrence() {#a2c90afd148f896bab791bdcad6b41dd0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>WidenIV::WidenedRecTy WidenIV::getWideRecurrence (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-simplifyindvar-cpp-/wideniv/narrowivdefuse">NarrowIVDefUse</a> DU)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Is this instruction potentially interesting for further simplification after widening it&#39;s type?

In other words, can the extend be safely hoisted out of the loop with <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> reducing the value to a recurrence on the same loop. If so, return the extended recurrence and the kind of extension used. Otherwise return &#123;nullptr, ExtendKind::Unknown&#125;.
